  5. Determine boot orders
  6. Register Bajos/plugins

list.title: module:boot#boot
list.description: The entry point to boot Bajo based application

list.title: module:boot/buildConfig#buildConfig
list.description:
Building configuration object. Read configurtion file from app data directory, program arguments and envoronment variables with following priority: Env > Args > Config file > defaults config

If data directory is provided and doesn't exist yet, it will be automatically created.

Config file must be located in: <data dir>/config/bajo.<format>, and support either .json or .js format. JS format must be a nodejs module that wrap an async function and return an object

list.title: module:helper
list.description:
Bajo Helper is a general-purpose container that consists of functions, objects, or arrays that are accessible across all plugins/Bajos and applications. It also serves as a proxy to some exported third-party libraries.

To use it, simply deconstruct the variables you want from Bajo Helper as shown in the example below.

list.title: module:helper#logLevels
list.description: Supported logger levels including its level priority

list.title: module:helper/3rdPartyLibs#3rd Party Libraries
list.description:
Attached As Package Name Usage
_ lodash const { _ } = this.bajo.helper
callsites callsites const { _ } = this.bajo.helper
dateFormat dateformat const { dateFormat } = this.bajo.helper
fastGlob fast-glob const { fastGlob } = this.bajo.helper
flatten flat const { flatten } = this.bajo.helper
freeze deep-freeze-strict const { freeze } = this.bajo.helper
fs fs-extra const { fs } = this.bajo.helper
lockfile proper-lockfile const { lockfile } = this.bajo.helper
outmatch outmatch const { outmatch } = this.bajo.helper
semver semver const { semver } = this.bajo.helper
unflatten flat const { unflatten } = this.bajo.helper
